correct answer: (B) 填星所在，歲星從之，伐者利                           Explanation:                           The question mentions that in ancient Chinese astronomy, the concept of "fault" was used to describe the movement of celestial bodies. When a faster planet approaches a slower one, it is said to "attack" or "fault" the slower planet. In the case of Jupiter and Saturn, when they are in close proximity, it is said that the faster planet "faults" the slower one. The passage provided by the user discusses the historical significance of Jupiter's approach to Saturn and how it was believed to bring certain advantages to those who were in a position of power. Therefore, the most appropriate answer is (B) 填星所在，歲星從之，伐者利, which means that when Jupiter (the filler star) is in the same area as Saturn (the stored star), the one who attacks will be successful.
